Ideas for a California Vacation in November 2015 California Travel Notebook: November Sign Up for our Free Newsletters Thanks, You're in! Health Tip of the Day Sign up There was an error. Please try again. Please select a newsletter. Please enter a valid email address. Did you mean ? Expert Videos 
If you're planning a trip to California this November - or if you're a California resident who wants to visit another part of the Golden State - I'm opening my travel writer's notebook to show you what's inside. 
Here's a roundup of all kinds of things to do, things we like and fun events happening in California this November. Time for New Olive Oil at Kiler Ridge Near Paso Robles. ©2013 Betsy Malloy Photography. Used by Permission. • November's Big Holiday: Thanksgiving 
Of course there's the traditional family meal, but after you're finished stuffing yourself, you have 3 days to play. 
Forget those crazy Black Friday sales, shop online on Cyber Monday and spend the rest of the time having fun. Just a few of things you can do over Thanksgiving weekend include running events, the beginning of Christmas holiday celebrations and a couple of fun parades. More » Adapted from Cat/Flickr/CC BY-NC-SA 2.0 • Things I'm Enthusiastic About Right Now 
This year, I hope to enjoy one of my all-time favorite California Christmas parades, the Newport Beach Harbor Parade . And I was happy to discover that they now offer bleacher seating. Or maybe I'll just get a spot on one of the lighted boats and be part of the action. 
Between Christmas and New Year's, I'm longing for the desert: Palm Springs , Anza-Borrego , Joshua Tree . Maybe a quick stop in Pasadena on the way home to see Rose Parade preparations. 
I'm also gearing up to be online at the state parks reservation website at 8:00 a.m. sharp on November 1 because I want to stay at Crystal Cove Cottages next May. I know it's ridiculous, but that's how it works. Here's how you can make your reservations too . General Sherman Tree, Sequoia National Park. ©2009 Betsy Malloy Photography. Used by Permission. • The Best Things We Can Think of to Do in November 
If you're a cook who loves great olive oil, November is the only time you can get newly-pressed "olio nuovo" in California. Find out where to get it . 
Thanksgiving weekend is a nice time to visit Sequoia National Park . When I lived in LA, we did it every year, enjoying the park when it wasn't crowded, buying a holiday tree at a lot near Visalia to take home. Sequoia is nearly equidistant from LA or San Francisco, making it a good choice no matter where you live. 
One of our favorite San Francisco tour companies had a new addition recently. Vantigo offers city tours, beer tours and oyster experiences in classic VW vans. To their already lovely Lillie Belle (a cream and red beauty) they have added Harvey, a handsome, classic blue devil named after Harvey Milk. 
Dungeness Crab season starts in November. You'll find lots of restaurants starting to feature it on their menus. This is the Last Sign You Want to See On Your Vacation. Thomas Hawk/Flickr/2893963392_03afacf912_o.jpg If you want to get a grandstand seat for the Rose Parade, camping reservations for next June or see the elephant seals Ano Nuevo State Park, get busy this month. More » Golden Gate Bridge in the Rain. © 2012 Betsy Malloy Photography. Used by Permission. • We Hope It Rains in November 
It might put a damper on your travel plans, but boy, do we need it! Just in case our dreams come true and your vacation plans are sinking faster than the Titanic, here are some ideas for things to do on a rainy day in California:
